item.description:
Please join me and the NQTA for a short 2 mile hike tomorrow morning. The NQTA president, Bob Curley always welcomes our group members to join the fun.


Here's his email regarding this hike:


Hello all ,

NQTA this weekend completed the shelter and built 2 brook crossing bridges at Bill Roses property were we hiked recently.

Tomorrow lets go for a hike there. Its a short 2 mile

( easy - peasy )

It s going to be cold with a little snow in the forecast so bundle up and I'm going to have a hot treat for us to have at the shelter

As usual 9 o'clock at the Y our you can meet us at Red Apple Farm parking lot.

Happy Trails. Bobby

Please let me know which location you will be at to meet up with the NQTA. It's a short trip to Red Apple Farm from the Athol YMCA so if you would rather meet at the Red Apple Farm, I would suggest being there at 9am and waiting for the arrival of everyone from the YMCA location. I will be meeting with the NQTA group at the Athol YMCA, outside at the parking area to the left of the building, at 8:45 am to hear what Bob has to say regarding this hike. I am posting that location but here's the Red Apple Farm location too...

Red Apple Farm

455 Highland Ave, Phillipston, MA

This link is for directions from the Athol YMCA to the RED Apple Farm...


http://goo.gl/maps/DFk3Y
item.how_to_find_us: I drive a maroon Chevy Monte Carlo.

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Tuesday hikes w/North QuabbinTrails Association
